description: Spain’s strongest opposition party comfortably won Galicia’s regional election, while Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez’s Socialists lost about a third of its seats in the first electoral test since he sought an amnesty for Catalan separatists.
title: Spain Conservatives Win Regional Election as Socialists Retreat

description: Mexican protesters took to the streets on Sunday in a “march for democracy,” saying President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador could be unfairly influencing upcoming elections in Latin America’s second-largest economy.
title: Mexican Protesters Blast AMLO in ‘March for Democracy’ Ahead of Presidential Election

description: UK opposition leader Keir Starmer said the “fighting must stop now” in Gaza, as he prepares for another sensitive Parliament vote this week that could reignite tensions in his Labour Party.
title: Starmer Urges End to Gaza Fighting as UK Vote on Ceasefire Looms

description: Former South Carolina Governor Nikki Haley assailed Donald Trump’s foreign policy, condemning the former president for his silence on the death of Russian opposition leader Alexander Navalny.
title: Nikki Haley Assails Trump for Silence on ‘Hero’ Navalny’s Death

description: NATO members now talk privately about a Russian attack on one of them as a danger that demands an urgent response, as they grow to doubt that the US will maintain its traditional role of protecting Europe as part of the alliance.
title: Ukraine’s Allies Are Gaming Out a World in Which the US Retreats

description: MEXICO CITY (AP) —
title: Thousands March in Mexico City Against President, Ruling Party

description: Israel will launch a ground offensive in the Rafah area of Gaza unless the hostages still held by Hamas are released by the Ramadan holiday in March, Israeli Minister Without Portfolio Benny Gantz said on Sunday.
title: Israel to Launch Rafah Offensive Unless Hostages Home by Ramadan

description: Two years into Russia’s invasion, advances in drone warfare have been hailed as a way for Ukraine to partly neutralize Russia’s military advantage.
title: Drone Warfare, AI Risks Are Among the Big Munich Talking Points

description: Donald Trump is marketing a self-branded $399 metallic gold high-top sneaker after being ordered by a New York judge to pay $364 million for lying about his wealth.
title: Trump Hawks Gold, Self-Branded $399 Sneaker as Legal Fees Mount

description: Israel summoned Brazil’s ambassador for a reprimand after President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva compared its war on Hamas with Adolf Hitler’s extermination of Jews during the Holocaust.
title: Israel Summons Brazil Ambassador After Lula’s Comments on Gaza

description: The European Union should work on a plan to issue €100 billion ($107.8 billion) in eurobonds to boost the continent’s defense industry, and in the meantime do more to get weapons to Ukraine, Estonia’s prime minister said.
title: EU Should Sell Joint Bonds to Boost European Defense, Estonian PM Says

description: Germany is set to face new travel disruption next week as labor union Verdi calls for a one-day warning strike of Lufthansa AG ground personnel starting February 20.
title: Lufthansa Travelers Face Upheaval as Ground Crews Strike Again

description: The European Union is close to hitting Apple Inc. with its first ever antitrust fine as well as a ban on App Store rules that the bloc believes thwart competition, according to the Financial Times.
title: EU to Fine Apple About €500 Million Over Music Services, FT Says

description: Hello again. Here’s what we’re talking about heading into the new week.
title: Another Grilling in Store for BOE’s Bailey: Sunday UK Briefing

description: Qatar’s foreign minister said negotiations aimed at securing an Israel-Hamas cease-fire and the release of hostages haven’t progressed as hoped, with issues such as how to address the unfolding humanitarian crisis in Gaza still to be resolved.
title: Qatar Says Negotiations Over Gaza Cease-Fire Are ‘Not Positive’

description: A South Korean doctors labor group warned the government of catastrophic consequences if it follows through on threats to punish medical students and trainees who plan to resign en masse on Monday.
title: S. Korean Doctors Warn of ‘Catastrophe’ If Punished for Strike

description: German Defense Minister Boris Pistorius urged US lawmakers to approve additional military aid for Ukraine stalled in Congress, warning that failure to do so could damage America’s economic interests.
title: Germany Says Failure to Back Ukraine Aid Could Hurt US Economy

description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — The U.S. has condemned Saturday Rwanda's support of the armed M23 group in eastern Congo, whose rebellion has caused the displacement of hundreds of thousands of people, and called on the rebel group to “cease hostilities.”
title: US Condemns Rwanda’s Support of Armed Rebels in Congo

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron will visit the Falkland Islands during a visit to the Americas, the Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office said on Sunday.
title: UK Confirms Foreign Secretary Cameron to Visit Falkland Islands

description: Over 400 people were detained in Russia while paying tribute to opposition leader Alexei Navalny, who died at a remote Arctic penal colony, a prominent rights group reported.
title: Hundreds Detained in Russia as Country Mourns Navalny

description: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said he met with Chinese counterpart Wang Yi on the sidelines of the Munich Security Conference over the weekend.
title: Ukraine Foreign Minister Met With Chinese Counterpart in Munich

description: At the height of the global pandemic, as Dubai faced an exodus of expatriates and mounting competition from neighboring business hubs, the government opened up. That decision is now helping the city dodge the commercial real estate crisis rippling across the globe.
title: Dubai’s Golden Visas Are Helping City Defy Global Office Slump

description: Former President Donald Trump vowed he would appeal the $364 million fine imposed by a New York judge over his business practices and railed against his mounting legal woes as he rallied supporters in the crucial 2024 battleground state of Michigan.
title: Trump Decries New York Fraud Case Ruling as Penalties Loom

description: Indian farmers will hold another round of talks with the government on Sunday to help end a dispute over crop prices after almost a week of protests by tens of thousands of growers in the north of the country.
title: Indian Farmers Gear Up for Talks After Almost Week of Protests
